alert.note: Alert for Osage; Shawnee; Wabaunsee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 16 at 6:27PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Shawnee, east central Wabaunsee and northern Osage Counties through 715 PM CDT... At 626 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Auburn, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. The small hail could accumulate on the ground in spots. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Topeka, Carbondale, Dover, Auburn, Burlingame, Scranton, Keene and Pauline. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 between mile markers 348 and 353. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 158 and 177. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
